abstract: The investment banker predicts more hostile offers pushed by activist investors and laments the standstill in European deals.
snippet: The investment banker predicts more hostile offers pushed by activist investors and laments the standstill in European deals.
lead_paragraph: For Kenneth D. Moelis, the founder and chief executive of the investment bank Moelis & Company, this is not, as Joan Crawford would say, his first time at the rodeo. Mr. Moelis has been an investment banker for over three decades, first at Drexel Burnham Lambert, then at Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette and UBS, where he helped build up their investment banks.

headline.main: Moelis Maps Out M.&A. State of Play
